planner.title: Unlock Your Potential as a Researcher
planner.subtitle: A one-hour online information session for aspiring postgraduate students.

sections.title: Session Aims
items: Clearly explain the programme structure and benefits.
Build a sense of community and support.

spotlight.title: Facilitator Focus
spotlight.text: Remember to speak clearly and slowly. Use polls and the chat for low-pressure interaction to help shy, B1-level participants feel comfortable and engaged.

slides.title: Unlock Your Potential as a Researcher
slides.subtitle: Welcome! We will begin in a few moments.

image.alt: A diverse group of students smiling and collaborating in an online meeting.

slides.title: Welcome to Our Session!
body: A few notes to help you feel comfortable.

cards.heading: Your Microphone
cards.description: Your microphone is off to keep the audio clear for everyone.

cards.heading: Your Camera
cards.description: Your camera is your choice. We are happy to see you, but it's okay to keep it off.

cards.heading: The Chat Box
cards.description: We will use the chat box to talk together. Please share your questions here!

image.alt: A view of the earth from space at night, showing city lights across continents.

activity.title: Let's find out who's in the room!
description: A poll should appear on your screen. Please select the city or region you are joining from today.

narrative: The word can sometimes sound big or difficult. But at its heart, it is very simple.

outcome.label: The Simple Truth
outcome.text: Research is curiosity with a plan.

image.alt: A neon question mark sign glowing brightly in the dark.

steps.title: Ask
steps.description: It starts with a simple question: 'Why...?' or 'What if...?'.

steps.title: Explore
steps.description: It uses a clear plan to find answers and understand the world.

steps.title: Impact
steps.description: It helps us create positive change for ourselves and our communities.

image.alt: Many diverse hands coming together in the center of a circle.

body.html: The most important quality of a researcher is not geniusâ€”it's curiosity. That means you can be a researcher.

activity.title: Share Your Curiosity
description: Use the chat box to share one topic you are curious about. It can be anything!

slides.title: This Programme is Your First Step

image.alt: A misty path marked by stacked stones, leading towards a bright, unclear horizon.

slides.title: Your 11-Month Learning Journey
aims: This programme is a complete, step-by-step guide from foundational knowledge to designing your own final project.
agenda: Unit 3: Focus Groups in Qualitative Research

slides.title: Months 1-4: Building Your Foundation
body: We start at the beginning to make sure you have a strong, confident foundation for your learning.

list.text: Understand the core principles of qualitative research.
Learn the practical skill of qualitative interviewing.

image.alt: Smooth, grey stones stacked carefully on top of each other, representing a solid foundation.

slides.title: Months 5-8: Deeper Skills
body: Next, we build on your foundation with more advanced methods for gathering and understanding information.

list.text: Learn how to effectively lead Focus Groups.
Discover how to analyze data and find meaning in it.

image.alt: A group of colleagues sitting around a table in a bright office, engaged in a discussion.

slides.title: Months 9-11: Bringing It All Together
body: In the final module, you will apply everything you have learned to create your own professional research project.

list.text: A complete, methodologically sound research study design.
Feel confident and ready for postgraduate study.

image.alt: Hands pointing at architectural blueprints and plans on a desk.

slides.title: A Supportive Way to Learn
body: We use a 'flipped classroom' model. This means more time for practice and discussion when we are together.

nodes.title: Step 1: Before Class
nodes.description: Review lectures and reading materials at your own pace.

nodes.title: Step 2: During Class
nodes.description: Use our live time for valuable discussion, activities, and questions.

slides.title: You Are Not Alone on This Journey

grid.title: Expert Lecturers
grid.description: Our friendly, experienced lecturers are here to guide you.

grid.title: English Support
grid.description: Integrated academic English support to help you write and speak with confidence.

grid.title: Certificates of Completion
grid.description: Earn a certificate for each unit to celebrate your progress.

image.alt: A friendly and professional woman with glasses, smiling warmly.

narrative: Your success is important, but your well-being is our highest priority. We are committed to creating a safe and supportive community for everyone.

slides.title: Logistics and Technology
body: Everything is designed to be simple and accessible.

cards.heading: What You Need
cards.description: A device with an internet connection. We use Zoom, Google Classroom, and WhatsApp.

cards.heading: Never Miss a Class
cards.description: All live sessions are recorded and made available for you to watch later.

slides.title: Meet Your Future Colleagues
slides.subtitle: You will learn with and from a community of peers on the same journey as you.

image.alt: A grid view of several different people in an online video conference call.

slides.title: Let's See Who is in the Room
Are You Ready to Begin?
slides.subtitle: Your research journey starts today with a single, simple step.

image.alt: A person's boot taking the first step onto a wooden walkway leading into a forest.

slides.title: Secure Your Place in 3 Easy Steps
body: I will now post the registration link in the chat. We are here to help you if you have any questions.

steps.title: Click the Link
steps.description: Find the registration link I have posted in the chat box.

steps.title: Fill the Form
steps.description: It's a simple Google Form with a few basic questions.

steps.title: Click Submit
steps.description: That's it! Your place is secured and we will be in touch.

slides.title: Thank You
body: We are so excited to welcome you to the programme.

body.html:
Any questions? Please ask in the chat.
Or contact us at: info@almanar.org
